Martin Luther King Jr. died on April 4, 1968, in Atlanta, Georgia, after passing away peacefully in his sleep. He was at home resting after delivering a speech in support of local teachers who were demanding better pay. His death was a significant loss for the civil rights movement, and it led to a surge in protests across the country.
